009
010package imagingbook.common.threshold.global;
011
012
013/**
014 * <p>
015 * This is an implementation of the global "minimum error" thresholder proposed by 
016 * Kittler and Illingworth in [1].
017 * See Sec. 9.1.6 (Alg. 9.6) of [2] for a detailed description.
018 * </p>
019 * <p>
020 * [1] J. Illingworth and J. Kittler. "Minimum error thresholding". 
021 * Pattern Recognition 19(1), 41â€“47 (1986).
022 * <br>
023 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>,
024 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
025 * </p>
026 * 
027 * @author WB
028 * @version 2022/08/01
029 */
030public class MinErrorThresholder implements GlobalThresholder {
031        
032        static final double EPSILON = 1E-12;
033        
034        private double[] S2_0, S2_1;
035        private int N;
036        
037        public MinErrorThresholder() {
038                super();
039        }
040        
041        @Override
042        public int getThreshold(int[] h) {
043                int K = h.length;
044                makeSigmaTables(h);     // set up S2_0, S2_1, N
045
046                int n0 = 0, n1;
047                int qMin = -1;
048                double eMin = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
049                for (int q = 0; q <= K-2; q++) {
050                        n0 = n0 + h[q];
051                        n1 = N - n0;
052                        if (n0 > 0 && n1 > 0) { 
053                                double P0 = (double) n0 / N;    // could use n0, n1 instead
054                                double P1 = (double) n1 / N;
055                                double e = // 1.0 + 
056                                        P0 * Math.log(S2_0[q]) + P1 * Math.log(S2_1[q])
057                                        - 2 * (P0 * Math.log(P0) + P1 * Math.log(P1));
058                                if (e < eMin) {         // minimize e;
059                                        eMin = e;
060                                        qMin = q;
061                                }
062                        }
063                }
064                return qMin; 
065        }
066        
067        private void makeSigmaTables(int[] h) {
068                int K = h.length;
069                final double unitVar = 1d/12;   // variance of a uniform distribution in unit interval
070                S2_0 = new double[K];
071                S2_1 = new double[K];
072                
073                int n0 = 0;
074                long A0 = 0;
075                long B0 = 0; 
076                for (int q = 0; q < K; q++) {
077                        long ql = q;    // need a long type to avoid overflows
078                        n0 = n0 + h[q];
079                        A0 = A0 + h[q] * ql;
080                        B0 = B0 + h[q] * ql*ql;
081                        S2_0[q] = (n0 > 0) ? 
082                                        unitVar + (B0 - (double)A0*A0/n0)/n0 : 0;       
083                }
084                
085                N = n0;
086                
087                int n1 = 0;
088                long A1 = 0;
089                long B1 = 0; 
090                S2_1[K-1] = 0;
091                for (int q = K-2; q >= 0; q--) {
092                        long qp1 = q+1;
093                        n1 = n1 + h[q+1];
094                        A1 = A1 + h[q+1] * qp1;
095                        B1 = B1 + h[q+1] * qp1*qp1;
096                        S2_1[q] = (n1 > 0) ? 
097                                        unitVar + (B1 - (double)A1*A1/n1)/n1 : 0;
098                }
099        }
100        
101}
